articles.author: Yu Xie, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: Country Garden's (2007.HK) deal with creditors for an extension on onshore debt payments worth 3.9 billion yuan ($536 million) boosted shares in the developer on Monday and gave China's crisis-ridden property sector some much-needed respite.
articles.title: Country Garden debt deal, China property support moves trigger relief rally

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Huawei Technologies and China's top chipmaker SMIC (0981.HK) have built an advanced 7-nanometer processor to power its latest smartphone, according to a teardown report by analysis firm TechInsights.
articles.title: Teardown of Huawei's new phone shows China's chip breakthrough

articles.author: Jan Schwartz
articles.description: Ford (F.N) will push back series production of its long-awaited SUV Explorer model at its Cologne site by around six months to wait for a new generation of Volkswagen (VOWG_p.DE) battery technology to be available, its Germany chief said on Monday.
articles.title: Ford pushes back Explorer series production in Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp (WBC.AX) on Tuesday said it was aware of legal proceedings launched by the country's corporate regulator alleging the lender's failure to assist its customers with financial hardship notices between 2015 and 2022.
articles.title: Westpac acknowledges legal proceedings on financial hardships negligence

articles.author: Yoruk Bahceli
articles.description: Belgium has raised a record 21.9 billion euros ($23.65 bln) from savers in a bond sale designed to compete with bank deposits, a sign of growing popularity for government debt as discontent grows with lenders failing to keep up with surging interest rates.
articles.title: Belgium raises record 22 bln euros from savers in 'clear signal' for higher bank rates

articles.author: Amy-Jo Crowley, Pablo Cerqueiro, Milana Vinn
articles.description: Barclays Plc (BARC.L) is exploring the sale of a stake in the unit that processes payments for UK merchants as the British bank seeks a partner to help grow the business, four people familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Barclays explores sale of stake in $2.5 billion UK payments unit – sources

articles.author: Maggie Fick
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) launched its weight-loss injection Wegovy in Britain on Monday, its second debut in Europe in just over a month as the drugmaker seeks to expand in the region even as it struggles to keep up with soaring demand.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk launches weight-loss drug Wegovy in Britain

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan will try to convince Kremlin chief Vladimir Putin to return to a Ukraine grain export deal that helped ease a global food crisis, when the two leaders meet in Russia's Black Sea resort of Sochi on Monday.
articles.title: With grain deal in focus, Putin to meet Erdogan in Russia

articles.author: Victoria Waldersee
articles.description: Europe's carmakers have a fight on their hands to produce lower-cost electric vehicles (EVs) and erase China's lead in developing cheaper, more consumer-friendly models, executives said at Munich's IAA mobility show.
articles.title: Europe's carmakers fret over China's EV prowess at Munich car show

articles.author: Tife Owolabi
articles.description: More than 60 people arrested last week in Nigeria in connection with an alleged gay wedding, which is illegal in the country, have been remanded in prison, the police and their lawyer said on Monday.
articles.title: Nigerian court remands dozens in prison over alleged gay wedding
